uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat
Class HeaderAnnotation

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat.HeaderAnnotation

public final class HeaderAnnotation
extends java.lang.Object

Immutable value object for an AnotationElement of an SBSI Header file. Equality is based on the value of getName(). Name is always a non-null,non-empty String, value is always non-null but can be an empty string.

Author:
Richard Adams

Method Detail

createAnnotation

public static HeaderAnnotation createAnnotation(java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.String value)
Creates an annotation element. External clients constructing these objects should use the following idiom:
   if (HeaderAnnotation.canCreate(name, value) {
     HeaderAnnotation = HeaderAnnotation.createAnnoation(name, value);
in order to ensure that annotation elements are constructed according to syntax rules.

Parameters:
name - A non-null, non-empty string conforming to the syntax rules of Annotation elements.
value - A non-null, possibly empty string.
Returns:
An HeaderAnnotation element.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or "", or value is null or canCreate() returns false.

canCreate

public static boolean canCreate(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
Tests if name/value annotaion elements can create a syntactically valid HeaderAnnotation element.

Parameters:
name - A candidate name
value - A candidate annotation value
Returns:
true if can create element with these values, false otherwise
